data.title: Shakespeare's Staging
data.text:
Alexander, Peter, ed. Richard III. London: BBC; New York: Mayflower, 1983.

Ashcroft, Peggy. "Margaret of Anjou." Shakespeare Jahrbuch (West) 109 (1973): 7-9.

Ashcroft, Peggy. "Playing Shakespeare." Shakespeare Survey 41 (1988): 11-19.

Barker, Margaret. Garrick. London, 1948.

Campbell, Lily B. Shakespeare's Histories, Mirrors of Elizabethan Policy. San Marino: Huntington Library, 1947.

Casey, Jim. "'Richard's Himself Again': the Body of Richard III on Stage and Screen." in Shakespeare and the Middle Ages: Essays on the Performance and Adaptation of the Plays with Medieval Sources or Settings, edited by Martha Driver and Sid Ray, 27-48. Jefferson, NC: McFarland, 2009.

Churchill, George B. "Richard III" Up to Shakespeare. Berlin: Palaestra, X, 1900.

Cibber, Colley. The Plays, vol. 1 [incl. Richard III], edited by William J. Burling and Timothy J. Viator. Cranbury, NJ: Fairleigh Dickinson Press, 2000.

Clemen, Wolfgang. A Commentary on Shakespeare's "Richard III." Translated by Jean Bonheim. London: Methuen, 1968.

Colley, John Scott. "Richard's himself again": a Stage History of "Richard III." New York: Greenwood Press, 1992.

Cox, Brian. The Lear Diaries: the Story of the Royal National Theatre's Productions of Shakespeare's "Richard III"and "King Lear." London: Methuen, 1992.

Crowl, Samuel. "Changing Colors like the Chameleon: Ian McKellen's Richard III from Stage to Film." Post Script: Essays in Film and the Humanities 17, no. 1 (Fall 1997): 53-63.

Diether, Jack. "Richard III: The Preservation of a Film." Film Quarterly 11, no. 3 (Spring 1957): 280-93.

FitzSimons, Raymond. Edmund Kean: Fire from Heaven. London: Hamilton,1976.

Furness, H. H., ed. The Tragedy of Richard III. Philadelphia: Variorum, 1909.

Geckle, George. "Shakespeare's Rhetoric Versus the Ideology of Ian McKellen's Richard III." Theatre Symposium: A Journal of the Southeastern Theatre Conference 5 (1997): 50-63.

Gillingham, John. The Wars of the Roses: Peace and Conflict in Fiftheenth-Century Englad. Baton Rouge: Louisiana State University Press, 1981.

Greg, Walter W., ed. The True Tragedy of Richard the Third. Oxford: Malone Society, 1929.

Hammond, Antony, ed. King Richard III. London: Arden, 1981.

Hankey, Julie, ed. Richard III. Totowa: Barnes & Noble, 1981.

Hassell, R. Chris. Songs of Death: Performance, Interpretation and the Text of "Richard III." Lincoln: University of Nebraska, 1987.

Hazleton, Nancy J. D. Historical Consciousness in Nineteenth Century Shakespeare Staging. Ann Arbor: UMI, 1987.

Hodgdon, Barbara. "The Wars of the Roses: Scholarship Speaks on the Stage." Deutsche Shakespeare-Gesellschaft West Jahrbuch (1972): 170-84.

Hodges, C. Walter. Shakespeare and the Players. London: Benn, 1948.

Holmes, Martin. Shakespeare and Burbage. Totowa, NJ: Rowman & Littlefield, 1978.

Hopkins, Lisa. "'How Very Like the Home Life of Our Own Dear Queen': Ian McKellen's Richard III." In Spectacular Shakespeare: Critical Theory and Popular Cinema, edited by Courtney Lehmann and Lisa Starks, 47-61. Madison, NJ: Fairleigh Dickinson University Press; London: Associated University Presses, 2002.

Irving, Henry, ed. Richard III. London, 1877.

Jones, Emrys. "Bosworth Eve." Essays in Criticism 25 (1975): 38-54.

Kalson, Albert E. "The Chronicles in Cibber's Richard III." Studies in English Literature, 1500-1900 3, no. 2 (1963): 253-267.

Legge, Thomas. Richardus Tertius. Translated by Robert J. Lordi. New York: Garland, 1979.

Loehlin, James Norris. "Playing Politics: Richard III in Recent Performance." Performing Arts Journal 15, no. 3 (September 1993): 80-95.

Lordi, Robert J. "The Relationship of Richardus Tertius to the Main Richard III Plays." Boston University Studies in English 5 (1961): 139-53.

Lull, Janis, ed. King Richard III. Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1999.

Mannheim, Michael. "The Henry VI-Richard III Tetralogy." Shakespeare on Film Newsletter (1982): 2, 4, 12.

Moore, James A. "Stage history." In "Richard III": An Annotated Bibliography, 529-696. New York: Garland, 1986.

Morse, Ruth. "Richard III: Texts and Performances." In William Shakespeare, "Richard III": Nouvelles Perspectives Critiques, edited by Francis Guinle and Jacques Ramel, 195-211. Montpellier: Université Paul-Valéry, 2000.

P., G. M. "Henry VI and Richard III: BBC Shakespeare." Cahiers Elisabéthains 24 (October 1983): 80-3.

Potter, Lois. "The Actor as Regicide: Recent Versions of Richard III on the English Stage." In Le Tyran: Shakespeare contre Richard III, edited by Dominique Goy-Blanquet and Richard Marienstras, 140-50. Amiens: C.E.R.L.A. Amiens-Charles V, 1990.

Potter, Lois. "Bad and Good Authority Figures: Richard III and Henry V since 1945." Shakespeare-Jahrbuch (Bochum) (1992): 39-54.

Potter, Robert. "The Rediscovery of Queen Margaret: The Wars of the Roses, 1963." New Theatre Quarterly 4, no. 14 (1988): 105-19.

Ribner, Irving. The English History Play in the Age of Shakespeare. Princeton: Princeton University Press, 1957.

Richmond, Hugh M., ed. Critical Essays on Shakespeare's "Richard III.". New York: G. K. Hall, 1999.

Richmond, Hugh M. King Richard III. Shakespeare In Performance. Manchester: Manchester University Press, 1990.

Russell Brown, John. "Three Kinds of Shakespeare: 1964." Shakespeare Survey 18 (1965): 147-55.

Sher, Antony. The Year of the King. London: Chatto & Windus, 1985.

Silviria, Dale. "Actor and Director: Richard and Richard's World." In Laurence Olivier and the Art of Film Making, edited by Dale Silvira, 218-85. Cranbury, NJ: Associated University Presses, 1985.

Spencer, Christopher, Five Restoration Adaptations of Shakespeare. Urbana: University of Illinois Press, 1965.

Spivack, Bernard. Shakespeare and the Allegory of Evil. New York: Clombia University Press, 1958.

Sprague, A. C. Shakespeare and the Actors. Cambridge, Mass.: Harvard University Press, 1944.

Sprague, A. C. Shakespeare's Histories: Plays for the Stage. London: Society for Theatre Research, 1964.

Stopes, Charlotte C. Burbage and Shakespeare's Stage. London: De la More Press, 1913.

Richard III at Talkin' Broadway.

Trewin, John C. Shakespeare on the English Stage, 1909-1964. London: Barrie and Rocklith, I964.

Ward, A. C., ed. Specimens of English Dramatic Criticism, XVII-XX Centuries. London: Oxford University Press, 1945.

Warren, Roger. "Shakespeare in England, 1982-83." Shakespeare Quarterly 34 (1983): 334-40.

Wells, Stanley. "Television Shakespeare." Shakespeare Quarterly 33 (1982): 261-77.

Wells, Stanley. "The History of the Whole Contention." Times Literary Supplement, February 4, 1983.

Wood, Alice Ida Perry. The Stage History of Shakespeare's "King Richard the Third." New York: Columbia University Press, 1909.
